brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate the prevalence and clinical significance of sleep-disordered breathing (SDB)
      in children.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Sleep-Disordered Breathing in Children

detailed_description.textblock:
BACKGROUND:

      SDB in children appears to be a common condition, affecting approximately 1 to 3 percent of
      children. Many aspects of childhood SDB remain understudied and poorly understood, including
      its precise prevalence, the optimal means of identifying children who should undergo
      polysomnography, and the potentially major impact of this condition on health, cognitive
      development, and behavior.

      DESIGN NARRATIVE:

      The population-based, cross-sectional study of 6- to 16-year-old schoolchildren in Dauphin
      County, Pennsylvania is a two-part study. In the first part of the study, parents of every
      child enrolled in local elementary schools will complete a questionnaire that will assess
      general sleep, behavior, and learning problems. In the second part of the study, 1,000
      children will be randomly selected based on their risk for SDB, as determined by the
      questionnaire. They will be evaluated in a sleep laboratory to determine the presence of
      SDB. A thorough pediatric ear, nose, throat, and pulmonary evaluation will be conducted;
      school records and behavior will also be assessed. The parents of the children will be
      interviewed, and information will be collected on the family history of risk factors
      associated with childhood SDB. This strategy will be beneficial in establishing the
      prevalence and clinical significance of SDB in children.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Phase I:  Sampled all children by questionnaire completed by parent or guardian in
             three school districts in Dauphin County, Pennsylvania

          -  Phase II:  Recruited a representative sample of 700 to complete a more detailed
             analysis in the laboratory

study_pop.textblock: Random representative population sample of children in elementary school (K-5)

facility.name: Pennsylvania State University Hershey Medical Center

clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Sleep Disordered Breathing in Children

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)
